column4: I currently have an ubuntu server install from 2008 sometime... I originally installed it onto a single IDE drive using LVM for my volumes. I want to actually move it to two new hard drives running in RAID1. Will there be any problems copying everything from LVM "volumes" onto just plain partitions? I don't have interest in using LVM any more.
I don't see why you would have an issue, are you going to maintain the same filesystem
I mean structure, from / on up

well... I'm taking the files, etc... probably going to format the new one ext4. I believe I know all the other details of the operation, just wondering if forgoing the LVM stuff will cause any problems
that's low level as far as the files are concerned. You should be able to move that pretty easily.
as I thought, so. cool. I should just use cp -a /old /new, right?
you may hav issues with some config files that are coded to look at a particular drive location, and you will have grub to deal with.
pretty much. yeah.
you should print out a filesystem map of some sort, as a reference
like your old fstab, grub config, etc.
yep. of course.
and, if it doesn't work the first time you still have your old drive.
yea, I'm excited to get rid of the IDE drive... I believe it is my last IDE still in use.
that's all I run, man :)
IDE??
I don't have one of them fancy new computers.
ah, ok. Mine isn't too fancy either... just an Athlon64... like 5+ years old now
have you ever run ecryptfs on your system?
sorry, no.... no encryption
not even to "play" with it?
